snippet: A judge for the National Labor Relations Board ruled that a production manager’s complaints about the Manhattan private school’s last-minute attempts to sanitize a play were covered by labor law.
abstract: Judge Arthur J Achman of the National Labor Relations Board orders Manhattan's elite Dalton School to reinstate David Brune, drama teacher who had been fired after hotly criticizing administrator Ellen Stein via email; Brune was upset with Stein for bowing to pressure from parents who were outraged by racial stereotypes in school's production of musical Thoroughly Modern Millie.
lead_paragraph: A judge for the National Labor Relations Board ruled that a production manager’s complaints about the Manhattan private school’s last-minute attempts to sanitize a play were covered by labor law.

headline.main: Dalton School Ordered to Rehire Teacher Who Criticized Bosses in Email
headline.print_headline: Dalton School Ordered to Rehire Teacher Who Criticized His Bosses in Email
